samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. Their work was originally conceived as an implementation and extension of the S programming language. The first official release of R occurred in 1995, and since 1997, R has been developed by the R Core Team, which includes Ihaka and Gentleman along with other statisticians and computer scientists from around the world.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. The first official release of R occurred in 1995, and since 1997, R has been developed by the R Core Team, which includes Ihaka and Gentleman along with other statisticians and computer scientists from around the world.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R, though development of the language had begun in the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R, though development of the language had begun in the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.
